edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.fullSimulationROM

Class OTFullSimROMDDHOnGroupElementSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.fullSimulationROM.OTFullSimROMDDHOnGroupElementSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OTSender, Covert, Malicious, OneSidedSimulation, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel, SemiHonest, StandAlone

    public class OTFullSimROMDDHOnGroupElementSender
extends java.lang.Object
implements OTSender, Malicious, StandAlone
    Concrete implementation of the sender side in oblivious transfer based on the DDH assumption that achieves full simulation in the random oracle model.

    This class derived from OTFullSimROMDDHSenderAbs and implements the functionality related to the group elements inputs. For more information see Protocol 7.5.1 page 201 of Efficient Secure Two-Party Protocols by Hazay-Lindell; this is the protocol of [PVW] adapted to the stand-alone setting and using a Fiat-Shamir proof instead of interactive zero-knowledge.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 4.5 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during the serialization mechanism in the preprocess phase.
        CheatAttemptException - if the sender suspects that the receiver is trying to cheat in the preprocess phase.
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during the communication in the preprocess phase.
        CommitValueException - can occur in case of ElGamal commitment scheme.

    • Method Detail

      • transfer

        public void transfer(Channel channel,
                     OTSInput input)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Runs the transfer phase of the protocol.

        Transfer Phase (with inputs x0,x1)

        WAIT for message from R

        DENOTE the values received by (g,h)

        COMPUTE (u0,v0) = RAND(g0,g,h0,h)

        COMPUTE (u1,v1) = RAND(g1,g,h1,h)

        COMPUTE c0 = x0 * v0

        COMPUTE c1 = x1 * v1

        SEND (u0,c0) and (u1,c1) to R

        OUTPUT nothing

        Specified by:
        transfer in interface OTSender
        Parameters:
        channel - each call should get a different one.
        input - The parameters given in the input must match the DlogGroup member of this class, which given in the constructor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during the communication.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem in the serialization mechanism.
